data:
Bom dia 🌿🌼

We start with a 15 min guided meditation in nature to arrive in the here and now 🧘🏼‍♀️🍃

Afterwards we will enjoy a nice nature bath (1h 15min), in which I guide you through some specific mindfulness exercises for being in nature based on a mix of Shinrin Yoku 🌳 and Thich Nhat Hanh. 🪷

To close the session we have anothor meditation for 15 min. 🧘🏼‍♀️🍃

In both meditations we will sit on the ground (earth) so please bring a little towel or something to sit on.

We walk and meditate in the evening sun/sunset ☀️

The event is donation-based: 5-10€

About myself:
I have been living in Lisbon for 6 years, originally from Germany. I practice meditation since 2019. Last year I joined the Triratna Buddhist Community at Agora. I’m in the first year of the Dharma Training for Mitras, which will be the bases for the meditations.

„If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.“ Buddha

Looking forward 🌳

Até já,
Sandra

Thats the WhatsApp group for any type communication https://chat.whatsapp.com/KbXHDyaKOsh6mQduxZMlIT

Ola 🍃,

This is a monthly bookclub about nature, plants and animals from a scientific and mindful persepective. The motivation is to understand our world combined with the wish to reconnect with nature, our home.

In this edition we talk about

[Frans de Waal - mama’s last hug](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/45894068)

It is not necessary to have finished the book 🙂

Looking forward,
Sandra 🍃
Escola basica mestre arnaldo louro de Almeida

Bom dia 🍃☀️

In this série about *Lisbon plant terraces* - we visit each time a different private plant home, terraces, gardens, balconies, so we can discover and share more ideas about urban gardening.

This time we will be at Ines‘s place enjoying the Sunday morning vibes. 🌅

📍⛔️📍One super important note. Due to privacy Ines‘s home address will only be shared in the chat.
Ines has lots of plants she needs to give away, as she is leaving the place. Some are for free 🙂‍↔️🌻🌳🪴 Also Ines has a lot of knowledge around plants and letting them grow happily.

See you soon,
Ines & Sandra
🌿🍃🌱
